Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2017 07:24PM oreolau wrote: On May 10, 2017, I will be an ELEVEN YEAR stage IIIB survivor! Praising God!
Posts.Title: Stage III Cancer Survivors .... 10+ Years and Out AlwaysHope karen1956

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2009 08:55PM oreolau wrote: Linda, I know you just said you wouldn't be checking until after your appt., but I'm writing just in case you change your mind and check the boards again.  I also live in the Atlanta area, and was diagnosed with breast cancer (ILC) in May of 2006.  If the place you are going is Breast Care Specialists in the Northside area, you are in great hands!  I found my cancer myself as ILC doesn't show on mammo, went to my ob/gyn and this is where she sent me immediately.  I thank God every day for this group of female surgeons who know what they're doing.  I have yet to know a single woman who has been diagnosed who has not gone into a type of 'shock' at receiving this news.  Will check back to see how you are. Sheila Lawrenceville, GA
